meanings.definition: Sandworts: a type of plant that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soil.
meanings.sent1: The sandworts swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I spotted some lovely sandworts during our nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The sandworts seemed to be whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: The field of sandworts was a soft, green carpet under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals of the sandworts danced in the wind.

meanings.definition: Sandworts: plural form of sandwort, referring to multiple plants of this type.
meanings.sent1: We admired the variety of sandworts in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The sandworts added a touch of beauty to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The sandworts gathered for their annual garden party.
meanings.sent4: The sandworts stood together like a united front against the elements.
meanings.sent5: The garden was alive with the vibrant colors of the sandworts.
